availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John H. Yerby (Phillips County, Arkansas, farmer and soldier)

body.p: Phillips County, Arkansas, farmer and soldier. Arkansas native. First lieutenant in the First Arkansas Cavalry. Aide-de-camp to Colonel Archibald Dobbins. Prisoner of war from April 1864 to June 1865.

ab.bibl: Compiled Service Records of Confederate Soldiers who Served in Organizations from the State of Arkansas, NARA RG 109, Microfilm Series M317, Roll 0001. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Arkansas, Phillips County, Searcy Township, Old Town post office, p. 52. The War of the Rebellion: A Compilation of the Official Records of the Union and Confederate Armies. Series I- Volume XXXIV- Part III- Correspondence, Etc. (Washington, DC: Government Printing Office, 1891), 562-3. (accessed https://books.google.com/books?id=pL1ZAAAAYAAJ&pg=PA562&dq=%22J.h.+yerby%22&hl=en&sa=X&ved=0ahUKEwjDvOfVxL3VAhXCQiYKHUuZDMQ6AEIRDAF#v=onepage&q=yerby&f=false). The War of the Rebellion: A Compilation of the Official Records of the Union and Confederate Armies. Series II- Volume VIII (Washington, DC: Government Printing Office, 1899), 177. (accessed https://books.google.com/books?id=ZwMVAAAAYAAJ&pg=PA177&dq="J.h.+yerby"&hl=en&sa=X&ved=0ahUKEwjDvOfVxL3VAhXCQiYKHUuZDMQ6AEIKDAA#v=onepage&q=yerby&f=false)
